events.title: Pope Pius V Excommunicates Queen Elizabeth I
events.description: Pope Pius V issued the papal bull 'Regnans in Excelsis,' excommunicating Queen Elizabeth I of England and releasing her subjects from allegiance to her.
events.significance: This event intensified the religious conflict between Catholics and Protestants in England, contributing to ongoing political and religious tensions.

events.title: Samuel Colt Receives Patent for Revolver
events.description: Samuel Colt was granted a patent for his invention of the revolver, a firearm with a rotating cylinder holding multiple bullets.
events.significance: The revolver revolutionized firearms technology and had a lasting impact on military and law enforcement worldwide.

events.title: Communist Coup in Czechoslovakia
events.description: The Communist Party of Czechoslovakia, supported by the Soviet Union, seized full control of the government in a coup d'Ã©tat.
events.significance: This event marked the beginning of four decades of communist rule in Czechoslovakia and a significant Soviet expansion in Eastern Europe.

events.title: Cassius Clay Wins World Heavyweight Title
events.description: Cassius Clay (later Muhammad Ali) defeated Sonny Liston to become the world heavyweight boxing champion.
events.significance: This victory marked the rise of one of boxing's most iconic and influential figures, who later became a prominent social and political activist.

events.title: Croatia Declares Independence from Yugoslavia
events.description: Croatia formally declared its independence from the Socialist Federal Republic of Yugoslavia.
events.significance: This declaration was a key event in the breakup of Yugoslavia and led to the Croatian War of Independence.
